message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.IR

This paper is about natural language processing and specifically focuses on defining words in a textual context. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also uses a Transformer-based sequence-to-sequence model, which is a popular deep learning architecture for natural language processing tasks, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) another likely category. Additionally, the paper involves generating contextually appropriate definitions, which involves understanding the meaning of words in context, making cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) a possible category. The paper also involves training the model in an end-to-end fashion, which involves optimizing the model's parameters to minimize a loss function, making cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) another possible category. Finally, the paper involves information retrieval, as it aims to generate definitions for words, making cs.IR (Information Retrieval) a possible category as well.
